pages.title: Getting Wood
pages.text: Well, no use in dillydallying about for too long. If I'm going to be prepared, I need to get to work now.$(br2)I'll start by finding the nearest tree and punching it at the very base until it falls. Then, I'll need to gather up some rocks and sticks for my next move.
I'll eventually need to build a workshop; for now, I need a crafting table, to work smarter and not harder. Until then, I can make a crude axe to get some planks.

Debarking comes first; with stripped logs, I can make planks, and planks, sticks, if I need to. After, I should gather up more loose rocks and sticks and combine it with my crude axe to make implements for a crafting table:
After, I can affix the crafting tools to the plank I just processed earlier, like so:
Ta-da! A fully fledged crafting table. With this, I can now more efficiently saw up planks from logs, at a rate of three planks per wood log:
Additionally, I can create more complex items with my larger and more sturdy workspace. I should also look into making a $(thing)portable crafting mat$(), great for crafting on the go:
Now, I should look at making some basic tools. A $(thing)pickaxe$(), a weapon like an $(thing)arming sword$(), a $(thing)shield$() and a $(thing)drying rack$() sound like a good place to start.
